intro: Phyllostegia decumbens, commonly known as the creeping phyllodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, typically blooming in the summer months. Its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature, aiding in its propagation. Phyllostegia decumbens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
